remarks: In geometries of dimension lower than 2, any 3 points are colinear. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Aug-2019.)
statement:
tglngval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglngval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglngval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglngval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglngval.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
tglngval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
tgcolg.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
tgdim01ln.1 $e |- ( ph -> -. G TarskiGDim>= 2 ) $.
tgdim01ln $p |- ( ph -> ( Z e. ( X L Y ) \/ X = Y ) ) $.
